heisigStory: Person . . . glue. The few cases in which this character serves as a primitive should include some connotation of "adhering to" that distinguishes it from "glued to." Two examples follow.
koohiiStory1: 賀 TO EVERYONE WHO MADE IT TO 千 kanji!! Remember, after this, you´ll be 読ing japanese novels, the news, and the internet like a native. 吉 to ALL of you in your amazing japanese 往. :).
koohiiStory2: If a PERSON ADHERES to something, they stick to it like GLUE.

readingExamples: 付く (つ.く), 付ける (つ.ける)
